abstract: JPMorgan Chase on Wednesday reported $3.6 billion in third-quarter profit, as most of its businesses showed a dramatic upswing from the financial crisis at the same time last year.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase on Wednesday reported $3.6 billion in third-quarter profit, as most of its businesses showed a dramatic upswing from the financial crisis at the same time last year.
lead_paragraph: Update | 7:26 a.m. More from The New York Times’s Eric Dash and Jack Healy here.

abstract: JPMorgan appears to be taking advantage of the financial crisis, overtaking investment banking rivals.
snippet: JPMorgan appears to be taking advantage of the financial crisis, overtaking investment banking rivals.
lead_paragraph: A year after the financial system was brought to its knees, a resurgent JPMorgan Chase reported a second consecutive quarter of surprisingly strong profit on Wednesday, solidifying its position at the pinnacle of American banking.

headline.main: JPMorgan Chase Reports Strong Profit of $3.6 Billion
headline.print_headline: Powered by Investment Banking Gains, JPMorgan Chase Posts $3.6 Billion Profit

abstract: JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, said Wednesday that the bank’s once-strong and stable dividend could be ready to make a comeback, with the bank looking to increase its payout significantly early next year as long as the economy does not decline further.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, said Wednesday that the bank’s once-strong and stable dividend could be ready to make a comeback, with the bank looking to increase its payout significantly early next year as long as the economy does...
lead_paragraph: Shareholders of JPMorgan Chase could receive a nice gift in their Easter baskets next year: a fat dividend.

headline.main: JPMorgan Looks to Raise Its Dividend Next Year

abstract: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, warned that if the government required all over-the-counter derivatives to be cleared on an exchange, this would have a “material impact” on the bank’s future earnings.
snippet: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, warned that if the government required all over-the-counter derivatives to be cleared on an exchange, this would have a “material impact” on the bank’s future earnings.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, warned Wednesday that if the government required all over-the-counter derivatives to be cleared on an exchange, as the Obama administration has proposed, this would have a “material impact” on the bank’s future earnings.

headline.main: Dimon Sees Problems With Derivatives Rule
